review: Went last Tuesday night. The restaurant was not particularly busy. Service was soooo... slow.  Server rarely checked on us. They were also having some karaoke type contest where teams were answering trivia questions. It was annoying to listen to if you were not involved. Food was not very good.

This is the usual national chain restaurant place.  It looks like a TGIF Fridays restaurant. Food is just OK.  This is never going to be my first pick to go out.  Since I went here with a group of people it took them a few minuets to piece together a couple of tables.  I expected this.  The waitress acted like she did not care, did not want to be here and did not like that we were a large group.  she took our drink orders and came right  back with them. Two minuets later came back for our meal orders. Flash forward 35 minuets later she came out to tell us the kitchen was backed up and was working on our order and she would bring us free baskets of chips & dip since it was taking so long for our order.  10 minuets later she comes out with our meals and no chips and dip.  I ordered the spinach Florentine flatbread which was good and the cheese burger it was just OK.  A few of my friends did not want pickles or tomatoes, but they were on their sandwich.  Both of them were not happy.   In the future, I will only go to TGIF because someone just HAS to go to TGIF Friday's. Location        B Environment B Food              C Service          C

Alright food, but not worth the price. I ordered delivery for TGI's and got their $15 special that comes with a dessert, salad, and entree, and it was extremely disappointing. The dragon chicken was subpar, the wedge "salad" was literally just a chunk of a head of lettuce half-assedly sprinkled with cheese and some other cheap toppings, and the dessert was meh.  It might be a relatively mid-priced chain restaurant with decent prices, but even with a coupon or special this place is not worth taking your money to.

It's a Friday's, so you should go into it knowing what the food is like.  Generally, unhealthy, gut-busting food.  But some of it tastes good and you can watch games at the bar.   That said, this location tends to have problems with the service at the bar.  I went in and sat at the bar for fifteen minutes before I could get the bartender over to order a beer.  She never even acknowledged I was in the bar, despite passing me multiple times.  And of course, they were out of at least two of the eight or so beers on tap.  The bar was full of dishes which hadn't been bussed yet.  And a manager kept coming through the bar but didn't assist with drinks or bussing at all. I ordered dinner, and was never given silverware.  It was also near impossible to get more drinks - each time was about a wait of ten minutes.  Then, I received the check, with no pen.  So I had to wait another ten minutes for a pen so I could get out of there!

The bartenders were on point, but the management will tow your car early in the morning if you leave it there overnight.  I'm less than thrilled by their encouragement of drunk driving; won't be spending another dollar there, for sure.
Food was average. Not much to write home about,  but wasn't a total loss either.
The service was terrible. It took us 15min just to get menus, our food took an hour from when we ordered it, to when it arrived. Then it took 30min for us to get the check, then get our change back.
Service is hit-or-miss and food is mediocre.  Last time we were told we had to wait to be seated even though half the restaurant was empty!  We won't be going back.

It's A Friday's so I went in with low expectations.  They managed to somehow lower the bar.  Service was terrible, food took forever, and ultimately was cold.  I complained to the manager and he did not seem interested in receiving feedback.  Won't return.

We normally come here during the week for lunch, its obviously a different staff during that time than the staff here on the weekend's.  When we entered the hostess asked if we would like a table.  We wanted a booth and there were two open within two steps.  We asked if we could have one of them she said no because they were dirty.  My wife and I looked at each other and wondered why she couldn't get a cloth and clean it off.  She obviously saw the perplexed look on our faces and immediately offered the large round table style booth in the corner.   Then my wife ordered the mojito shaker and after we had to ask the waitress to check on why it was taking so long to be made, she finally showed up with a sweet syrup concoction that tasted nothing like a mojito.  Finally when we asked to speak to the manager, he showed up and proceeded to cut us off during the conversation.  He never let us finish a sentence while we were trying to tell him about what we were experiencing. TGI Friday's should really close this location and allow a better restaurant to have this space.  We will not be returning any time soon.
So nasty!!! Dirty dishes, greasy silverware, bad service and microwave food... Never coming back!!

We drove down from Pennsylvania to see the Duke men play. The hotel we stayed in was right up the street so within walking distance. I really didn't want to come here, but my husband did and since he's not a Duke fan and the whole trip was for me I said ok. Well we both wished we wouldn't have went here.  The only pros I can give you is the doors were held open for us when we came and when we left. Also I always order a burger and it was a burger from Fridays. Con: Our server was terrible and my husband and I have both served or are still serving so when I say terrible I MEAN it. He came over never introduced himself, asked for our drink order. He brought them back asked if we were ready, my husband was not, but we ordered fried cheese and he said he'd be right back for our order. He came back with our fried cheese and finally took our order. My husband ordered a side caeser and a special, me the burger. Also then he said is that everything? We go um yes. He brings out the caeser and our meals all at the same time. Goes does everything look ok? We go yes and he never came back. Well things weren't ok, first off it was a regular salad and his special had no mashed potatoes. The server see we finished our meals brings the check over and goes here ya go I'll be back to get that. No would you like any deserts or refills on your drinks? How was your meals, since I never checked on you?  The food was ok. It was a burger from Fridays.  My husband was NOT impressed with his. Not impressed with this place and wished we would have went to another place.
Pros: three dollar drinks on Thursdays. Cons: Saturdays, Sundays, Mondays, Tuesdays, Wednesdays and especially Fridays

Decided to order in from TGI's yesterday in the effort to try something new.  Menu was fairly variable but mostly heavy American fare.  The food arrived after about 30 min during dinner time; I was duly impressed especially considering how one time we ordered later at night and it took an hour for the food to arrive.   It cost about $13 for decent but not spectacular pecan encrusted chicken salad and $15 for extremely average steak with small broccoli florets and over seasoned sweet potato fries.  Very pricey for the quality of food, like Diana X. mentioned. One of the poorer dining options around Durham in my book.

Me, my mother in law and my husband decided to come here tonight. Bad choice. Our first server was all over the place forgetting everything. The steak was cooked wrong. Our first server "went home" and the replacement for him was rather rude. My mother in laws steak was cooked wrong and they asked if she wanted a new re-cooked one after everyone was done eating and our food was boxed up. This place is ridiculous as far as service goes. I got ribs and they were pretty good. I won't be coming back.
Service was terrible and food was also. I should have known better . It's actually my fault for even going there. It's on me.

I doubted the reviews as most TGIs are consistently good.  Well not this one at least near Duke Medical in Durham, NC and not with our waitress " Miss T " per the check.  Seemed disinterested in being there.  When one in our party of five changed her order the waitress rolled her eyes while looking at me.  Drink refills were only when empty and then I had to ask another server.  She - not sure of her name was very nice and helpful.  I think we just got a dud of a waitress.  Took 15+ mins to get our order and they were not at all busy at 1220 pm on Friday.  That should have been my sign.   Too many better choices to deal with this.  Never again.

THIS PLACE WAS AWESOME ON A MONDAY AFTERNOON. kinda a weird day to go but it wasnt too busy. customer service was great and didnt neglect nor bother us the whole meal and allowed us to relax and take our time . my waitress  was shauna (not sure of spelling ) she was more than excellent she answered  all questions with a promptly and was very knowledgeable on the menu. i will be looking for her again when i come back. the manager monday night was excellent  also both of the employees had a wonderful attitude and showed they were excited to have theyre jobs.  we had the unlimited appetizers buffalo wings. the first plate was brought out promptly as was our second too. i really dont have any complaints the tables were clean and not sticky the floors and the resturant were clean. however i didnt not use the bathroom so i dont know what they look like. some people apparently had really bad reviews of the place and theyre old. dont judge a food joint based on one visit.

My server was awesome.  Latoya F was one of the best servers I have had in this location.  I came in on a fairly busy Saturday night and sat in the bar.  The bartender was very busy and took forever on our drinks.  Latoya helped us as much as possible and accommodated our every request even though Steven ( I believe was the bartender) was not paying attention to anyone other than the girls he was busy flirting with.  Either way, she is the reason we will come back.  The ribs were pretty good and the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta was pretty good also.  We will come back to see her!

My first experience at TGI's was bad due to mediocre food and poor service, but I decided to give it another try because I had a coupon. So my friend and I were looking over the menu when the waitress snatched up the coupon from the table and told us we could only use the coupon Sunday through thursday. Then she told us she would let us decide whether we still wanted to stay or not (rudely). We most definitely left! And I won't be returning.

The Good: My party and I were seated very quickly. The menu was varied and provided for a wide range of tastes. Our server greeted us and took our drink order rather quickly.  The Bad: Our drinks took too long to deliver. The food took too long to come out. The noodles of my entree were overcooked. My shrimp were overcooked as well as my chicken. Entrees should have vegetables accompanying it. My entree only had two shrimps while the advertised photo shows plenty. Waiter took to long to bring out my ray bill and forever to return so I could pay and leave this godforsaken place.  The Ugly: David, our waiter, came to our table several times and never refilled our glasses though our selections are non alcohol based and can have refills... empty glasses on the table for about an hour.  I never asked for a refill though because I wanted to see if this experience would ńêt an ugly rating as it did.  Will not return to this location, must be accustomed to serving Duke and Central students who live in this area.

25 minutes seat till somebody come to ask me if I want a drink. Kids went to chipotle, got food, seat at the table and start eat BEFORE we have service. No wonder is so many empty tables In a Friday night on Fridays!!!!

Service terrible. Slow. Had to ask over and over for refills. Restaurant was slow. I don't understand it. Lol. My son had boneless wings and they were delicious. I had a chicken salad and it was nothing great.  It was terribly hot in restaurant and a turn off on an100 degree day.

Well how can I start this the service was awful and the restaurant was hot. I got 2 orders of boneless wings and my mom got salad her salad had barely any dressing but the boneless wings were amazing but the salad was awful
A/C not doing so good here today. Bit stuffy, hope food makes up for ut. The Arnold Palmer is on point!

This place was and is great!!!! The food, the service, and our waitress Kristin was the greatest!!!!! She was awesome, very helpful, very attentive, very sweet.  We weren't rushed like some restaurants for example "Ruth Chris Steakhouse".  Our waitress was so very nice that when we left she came out to us wanting to give us our change but that was all for her because she was wonderful and deserved the tip that was given to her. "Kristin "thank you" and keep up the great job"

Had a late dinner here on Sunday.  Party of 5 the hostess tried seat us at booth that was meant for 4, when we asked for table she acted very confused and a little upset.  She asked  what beverages we would like and everyone wanted water, one person asked for lemon, after a 10 minutes wait and 2 trips she brought water for everyone with at 5 pieces of lemon in each.  We all ordered the Endless Appetizers. To make a long story short it took FOREVER to get our food with the waitress only bringing out 1 appetizer every 10-15 minutes, after a more than 2 hour stay we finally got all our  food, the waitress through the kitchen under the bus.  I will be in this area for sometime but will never return to this TGI Friday nor will I recommend it to anyone.

The lady answering the phone is the meanest person I 've ever met. She misunderstood my order, kept me waiting for 3 hours, and didn't even apologize. I don't know what happened to her, maybe she just lost her family today. Sorry for her.

Man, the service is slow here. We had a party of 10-13 and there wasn't many people at the bar area around 2 pm on a Wednesday. From the time we gave our drink orders, it took over 20 minutes to get our drinks. I found myself looking around and didn't see anyone at the bar area. I was scratching my head on that one. We got some appetizers to share and I was pleasantly surprised how good they were. Also they have the Never ending Apps deal, which you can get your money's worth if you order at least 2 refills.

Went on a Saturday night with my gf. We each got the 3 appetizers for $13.50. Came with buffalo wings, loaded potatoes, and Mozzarella sticks. We received our food very quick. It was pretty good nothing to complain about. Waiter was nice and kept our glasses filled. Overall a nice evening so I'll give it 5 stars.

I took my son here last week to get some food and watch a basketball game. We sat in the bar area where the tv's are. We requested the bar tender to change the channel to the game we wanted. She replied 'no problem ". She then walked back to a very drunk group in the corner and laughed it up with them. We didn't get silverware, we weren't asked what we wanted to drink. After about 10 minutes I was able to get her attention and order drinks and asked again for the game. Note: the bar area is not busy at all! Still no game and another 5 minutes before our drinks. Still no silverware or offer of  menus. Bartender is only serving people that are already clearly intoxicated and of her own race. Hate to say that but it was very obvious and true. Food was pretty good when I finally got it but the overall experience was horrible and I will never return to this establishment again.  After the game had ended she finally changed the TV. We had asked for our check at this point already. I will not recommend this place to my worst enemies. Even they deserve better treatment than I received. Sadly I always tip at least 25%. Your loss

Have eaten here twice and had take out 3 or 4 times . Take out was late and cold. Food was over cooked and after complaining about my drink, the bar tender came to our table and confronted me and told me I was wrong. 3 strikes plus a couple and they are out!! We won't be going back.  Waiter was good and polite .
Nobody picked up the phone when I called the first 3 times. Ordered food and it has taken almost two hours. Can't say i'm a big fan.

Gave benefit of doubt and tried again.  Bad mistake!  Worst service at this location ever!  Could not even drink the mixed drink ordered and waitress just said, "Oh really, laughed and walked away. Hostesses were clueless, unprofessional as was the waitress. All the food did not come at same time, barely warm.  Waited for a spoon for our dessert over 10 min.  Wait time to get our check was over 15 min. and getting the card back took another 10 min.  No apologies, nothing.  TGIF needs to give management and staff at this location a wake up call!!!

If your looking for a night club playing decent hip hop with a DJ come here on Friday night! If you're looking for a place to eat and be able to hear yourself think don't bother, food was ok. First experience for TGIF BECOME A NIGHTCLUB! Craziest thing I have experienced including a bouncer at the front door, All they needed was a dance floor and smoke machine to round out the club.

TGI Friday's has never impressed me. Ever. But this one is especially bad. A friend wanted to go here for lunch so I agreed. There are half a dozen restaurants in walking distance of this place. On a busy lunchtime this place had a ton of empty tables. That should have been a warning. When every other place was packed out. Service was slow. The menu is huge and the pictures look great. What you get however will be nothing like the pictures. I had one of the new double stacked burgers. The bun was stale. The fries cold. The actual meat patties were about the size of what you find on a popular fast food double cheeseburger. The taste was horrible, with their new spreads. I removed the toppings and still had a tough time eating it. It is way expensive for what you get. $12 for a burger the size of a fast food double cheeseburger. The restaurant itself was pretty nice, but with slow service and bad food I would not return. Given the choice between this and fast food I will take Mickey D's any day. Just complete crap.

I should have looked at the other reviews before dinning here today.  It took 25 minutes for them to make sweet tea.  They brought one meal out 15 minutes before the rest; they then brought out the chicken and shrimp pasta with no pasta!  The food was sub par!  I do not recommend this restaurant at all!

My friend and I came up with this amazing idea to get endless apps while doing our homework here. It was totally cool with our waitress when we took out our laptops and she even helped us look for an outlet (we didn't find one). Then when my friend and I both ordered the endless apps, she told us she could just put in one order for the both of us. Score!!!  Our favorites were the BBQ chicken flatbread and Mozzarella sticks but honestly, all of the apps tasted great considering we were both paying half the price while getting homework done (yes, we did get work done).  I'm not sure if there's a rule against bringing endless apps To Go but at the end when our laptop batteries were dying and our stomachs were stuffed, our waitress let us put in one final order before giving us To Go boxes.  Needless to say, my friend and I did a little dance when we got back to our car.
GREAT service  waitress was Awesome. Kitchen manager unbelievable customer service. Our lunch special combo was great and the Blue Rita shaker was the best !!!

I won't visit this place again! You need to read all of reviews very carefully before you head out to TGIF at Erwin rd, Durham.  Indeed, I should have looked at the other reviews before dinning here today.  Quickly we got seat, but in 40 minute, we still did not have anything on our table.  When I told the waitress we were leaving, she said "oh ok, bye." She did not apologize at all.  We talked with the manager, and his apology did not look sincere and honest. What kind of culture is that? This place does not have ethics in there. It's a shame to have such a low quality restaurant we have in our community. I do not recommend this restaurant at all!

Have been there a couple of times, the most recent was to check out the NBA Finals, Game 2, and while we there on a Sunday there was a also a DJ and Karaoke thing going on that is apparently pretty regular weekend occurrence.   The DJ definitely had some skills, and as usual some of the Karaoke folks didn't need to quit their day jobs...Prices weren't too bad.......and the servers seemed to be pretty friendly.........

Food was awful completely over cooked and theg got my order wrong. (There were only two plates to bring to the table) The service was slow and it wasnt a busy night for them.. and we had to send our drinks back because we couldn't even taste the whiskey in the whiskey sour. Will not be coming back.

Service was terrible & so was the food. I refused to eat it. The waitress legit acted as if we were bothering her & the cook must've been having a bad day as well because our whole table had to return our meal.

It works perfectly fine, but it seems really expensive for lousy bar food and having most of the beers on tap being actually tapped out. Last time I was there they actually had my fourth (4th!!!!!) choice. Dos Equis.

watched as my entree was delivered to adjacent bar guest. After taking a bite, he realized it wasn't his dish and told the bartender. Server who delivered the meal then said, not to throw it away so it could be re-served. Fast forward 10-15 minutes, still no food. Bartender said it would be right out. 20 more minutes, manager walks by, and we ask about food. He says he will have it right up and not to 'be mad at him.' An hour later, no food. the manager on duty then asks 'what do you want me to do about it?' Hard to believe I was the only person in a two hour time frame who ordered a pasta. The manner in which the manager spoke to my husband was both condescending and ignorant. The blatant disrespect and overall lack of customer service demonstrated by this manager was easily the ugliest display of service I have seen after waiting tables for over 10 years. It's bad when the guests around you are complimenting your patience.

Worst possible customer service I've received in a while. Waitress was great but wasn't a bit familiar with the menu or drink menu. To begin with I order a cosmo my boyfriend orders a beer and I order royal flush shots as well. The BARTENDER comes over and tells me I can't have two drinks. I get that but I wanted shots not drinks. Which is what took me 10mins to explain. After all that explains he finally gets it and asks me what's in a royal flush. I let him know and he then makes ONE royal flush DRINK. She brings it over I let her know hey I wanted shots. She brings it back he then TAKES THE ONE DRINK POURS IT INTO TWO SHOT GLASSES!!!!! And yes I got charged 4 crown shots that were made with ONE DRINK. Insane. I then try again with something new and ask for kamakazi shots he asks me what's in it and then makes the same ONE drink. They were out of almost everything including fireball who runs out of that?! So I really believe they make money by getting off on people. The food also came out really late and was gross compared to the other number of tgis I've been to in charlotte I was disappointed. I let the manager know and instead of taking anything off he says he would "take care of my food next time" manager being DAVE. Yes just avoid it all and just don't come here you'll be highly disappointed!

Not sure it was even worth my time much less my money.  Bad service. Badly cooked. After waiting 44 minutes for our food to arrive to arrive. Pretty sure by the temp it was simply left in the window. Thanks for offering to simply remove the tomatoes from my salad. I ordered it without them now go remake it

WORST service i've ever experienced. I ordered a simple chicken and pasta dish for delivery about 5 mins away from their location. Not only did it take an hour and half to get here, but I was hung up on phone multiple times (one while asking a question), they also forgot to ask for my address. I called multiple time with a constant ringing number, when someone finally did answer they were very unpleasant. Food isn't worth the hassle- try Applebee's instead. UPDATE: never received my order or food. Never coming to this restaurant again.

Absolutely horrible- hostess couldn't figure out where to sit a party of 5. She walked us over to a table full of trash on the floor and dirty cups then quickly walked us around the corner to an empty table. Waited a few minutes and no waitress. My daughter opens her menu and a dead bug was in there. We left! The restaurant was empty but lots of dirty tables. Not sure what's happening but absolutely gross.
Went at an odd time in the day so there weren't not that many people there, but it was delicious and our food is yummy! The service was fabulous and loved the potato skins! Will definitely return.

The food and speed of service was good.  My major compliment comes in after leaving the restaurant. Three days later I realized I left my $300 dollar prescription sunglasses in the booth where I sat.  Since that time I flew 1500 miles away and called back to TGI Fridays. I called a few minutes before they opened and the general manager answered the phone. I told her my situation. She went to look for my glasses and about a minute later came back and said she found them. She then took my mailing address and told me they would be out in the mail today. I asked her how I should pay for the shipping and she said "we've got it, and  it will be in the mail." This is up and beyond any normal service. Great leadership with Tammy as manager!  Friendly staff all around.
